intro: Calluna vulgaris var. nana, commonly known as dwarf heather, is a compact, low-growing shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, depending on the variety. The plant has dark green, leathery leaves that are evergreen, providing year-round interest in gardens. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. This hardy plant is often used in rock gardens or as ground cover due to its resilience and ornamental value.
